column16: Life is Strange is an episodic, narrative-driven adventure game where photography student Max Caulfield discovers she can rewind time.

column16: Life is Strange: Before the Storm is a three-part episodic standalone game that serves as a prequel to Life is Strange and is set three years prior to the main game's events.

column16: How to Rob a Bank is the misadventures of a young and inexperienced bank robber and his female accomplice. Their story is revealed through the searches, texts, apps, and games they use on their phones.

column15: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International License.
column16: Dakota is a fast-paced audiovisual digital poem that synchronizes flashing text with jazz percussion to tell the story of a hard-drinking man racing through America’s heartland, haunted by the death of a friend and pursued by memories of masculinity, desire, and cultural ghosts.

column16: Please Answer Carefully explores the horror of the mundane - specifically, the act of taking another mind-numbing survey online - and draws on fears of stalking, control, and surveillance.

column16: Hours of the Night is an aesthetic kinetic poetry created collaboratively with Power Point (also available in video format) that tells about the interrupted pattern of sleep that said to be common at before.

column16: Cyberqueen by Porpentine Heartscape was created in Twine and explores the relationship between human and machine through a series of dialogue, description, and hyperlinked choices made by the reader.
